intro: Knautia calycina, commonly known as the Alpine knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to purple flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Knautia calycina thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine landscapes.
